dt: {bc}to take or go on a promenade
{bc}to perform a promenade in a dance

shortdef: to take or go on a promenade
to perform a promenade in a dance
to walk about in or on

dt: {bc}a leisurely walk or ride especially in a public place for pleasure or display
{bc}a ceremonious opening of a formal ball consisting of a grand march of all the guests
{bc}a figure in a square dance in which couples move counterclockwise in a circle

et: borrowed from French, "place for taking a stroll," from {it}promener{/it} (transitive) "to lead, take to different places," (intransitive and reflexive) "to walk from one place to another (to relax, take the air, etc.)" (alteration —with Latin {it}pro-{/it} replacing {it}pour-{/it}— of Middle French {it}pourmener{/it} "to lead, take to different places," going back to Old French, from {it}pour-,{/it} prefix marking determinate action —going back to Latin {it}prō-{/it} {et_link|pro-:2|pro-:2}— + {it}mener{/it} "to lead, bring") + {it}-ade{/it} {et_link|-ade|-ade} {ma}{mat|demean:2|}{/ma}
shortdef: a leisurely walk or ride especially in a public place for pleasure or display
a ceremonious opening of a formal ball consisting of a grand march of all the guests

dt: {bc}an upper deck or an area on a deck of a passenger ship where passengers stroll

shortdef: an upper deck or an area on a deck of a passenger ship where passengers stroll

dt: {bc}a musical concert during which many people who are listening stand instead of sit

shortdef: a musical concert during which many people who are listening stand instead of sit
